required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of CIED "Readers" for Disease Management
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cardiac Implanted Electronic Devices (CIED) "Readers" for Hospital Disease Management

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the use of remote interrogation (readers) of CIEDs in evaluation of suspected TIA/stroke patients, HF or those experiencing syncope. This approach has the potential to advance the practice of CIED evaluation by staff without specialized training in cardiac electrophysiology (non-EP staff). We hypothesize that actionable events will be identified with use of CIED readers. These events may include identification of atrial fibrillation in TIA/stroke patients, percentage biventricular pacing in patients with HF or evaluation of arrhythmic events in syncope patients. We believe that non-EP staff will find CIED readers easy or very easy to use and that time from transmission to analysis for non-EP trained staff will be low.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects with CIEDs undergoing evaluation for TIA/stroke, HF or syncope will be reviewed for inclusion/exclusion criteria. CIED interrogation, demographics and time of interrogation will be collected. Review of interrogation and medical record will be done to evaluate for actionable events including CIED programming, initiation or change in medications, admission/discharge or decision for further testing.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of actionable events after use of readers in suspected TIA/stroke, heart failure and syncope
primary_outcome.description: percent of those with events after reader review with actions such as admission/discharge, addition or change in medications, further testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Average number of minutes from transmission to analysis
secondary_outcome.description: number of minutes from CareLink Express interrogation to analysis

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of non-EP trained staff rating CIED readers as very easy or easy
other_outcome.description: Likert scale to staff on ease of use

study_pop.textblock: Subjects being seen in Edward ED, HF clinic or inpatient units being evaluated for HF, TIA/stroke or syncope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- have a Medtronic CIED compatible with Medtronic CareLink Express
- being evaluated for heart failure, TIA/stroke or syncope
- able to read and speak English
Exclusion Criteria:
-CIED from other than Medtronic
